item.title: Duellist
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

[quote=“mod eldest, post:14, topic:550792”][quote author=Limits link=topic=669703.msg4478209#msg4478209 date=1427596832]
Replying because mod eldest wants me to

Edit: Limits erased his main post because there is no use in arguing with incompetence.
[/quote]

Seems like you’re too afraid to come up with a logically sound argument against my previous statement. I have no doubt that you rewrote a good chunk of David Breckeen’s code just so you could say “it’s mine.” You’re the only one that is incompetent here.[/quote]
Math is math. You can’t come up with an “original” Transform class, or an “original” Vector class. They are both concepts that cannot be reinterpreted or looked at at a different perspective.

EDIT:
“hey guys, this leecher made a Circle class with a radius and a center point!”

  • “hahaha what a noob, he clearly has no idea what he’s doing”
    — “yeah he’s just copying code, what a loser”

Read full topic

item.title: Duellist
item.dc:creator: @Sapphirus Sapphirus
item.description:
@Sapphirus wrote:

[quote=“Limits, post:9, topic:550792”]To clear things up, this is my 6th attempt at writing a good one. It still sucks but it’s easier to use than the others and it also has the most features. I wrote 70% of the engine, the other 30% was from David Brackeens Developing Games in Java (for rendering methods).

That was the engine… I wrote 100% of the content which is listed in the Completed list[/quote]

The majority of the code for this project was not written by you. Just stop being dishonest with us.

[ul][li]Code that wasn't written by Limits[/li] [li]Code that was written by Limits[/li][/ul]

Completed:

  • animation system
  • collision (sphere collision) (both enemy and player)
  • asset managing
  • entity system
  • world managing
  • enemy follows and faces you (facing is still needing work because it rotates to the negative camera angle, and that is not proper) (Chapter 13, Artificial Intelligence)

Optional

  • real time lighting (for weapon and enemy)
  • crowd watching you and chanting

Engine Features:

  • convex polygon rendering using scan lines
  • diffuse lighting
  • texture mapping
  • skybox
  • transform system
  • software rendering

Sources: http://www.brackeen.com/javagamebook/

So in conclusion 99.99% of the credit goes to David Brackeens and others; 0.01% percent of the credit goes to you for figuring out how to use other peoples code.

EDIT:

David Breckeen’s code:

package com.brackeen.javagamebook.math3D;

/**
    The Transform3D class represents a rotation and translation.
*/
public class Transform3D {

    protected Vector3D location;
    private float cosAngleX;
    private float sinAngleX;
    private float cosAngleY;
    private float sinAngleY;
    private float cosAngleZ;
    private float sinAngleZ;

    /**
        Creates a new Transform3D with no translation or rotation.
    */
    public Transform3D() {
        this(0,0,0);
    }


    /**
        Creates a new Transform3D with the specified translation
        and no rotation.
    */
    public Transform3D(float x, float y, float z) {
        location = new Vector3D(x, y, z);
        setAngle(0,0,0);
    }


    /**
        Creates a new Transform3D
    */
    public Transform3D(Transform3D v) {
        location = new Vector3D();
        setTo(v);
    }


    public Object clone() {
        return new Transform3D(this);
    }


    /**
        Sets this Transform3D to the specified Transform3D.
    */
    public void setTo(Transform3D v) {
        location.setTo(v.location);
        this.cosAngleX = v.cosAngleX;
        this.sinAngleX = v.sinAngleX;
        this.cosAngleY = v.cosAngleY;
        this.sinAngleY = v.sinAngleY;
        this.cosAngleZ = v.cosAngleZ;
        this.sinAngleZ = v.sinAngleZ;
    }


    /**
        Gets the location (translation) of this transform.
    */
    public Vector3D getLocation() {
        return location;
    }

    public float getCosAngleX() {
        return cosAngleX;
    }

    public float getSinAngleX() {
        return sinAngleX;
    }

    public float getCosAngleY() {
        return cosAngleY;
    }

    public float getSinAngleY() {
        return sinAngleY;
    }

    public float getCosAngleZ() {
        return cosAngleZ;
    }

    public float getSinAngleZ() {
        return sinAngleZ;
    }

    public float getAngleX() {
        return (float)Math.atan2(sinAngleX, cosAngleX);
    }

    public float getAngleY() {
        return (float)Math.atan2(sinAngleY, cosAngleY);
    }

    public float getAngleZ() {
        return (float)Math.atan2(sinAngleZ, cosAngleZ);
    }

    public void setAngleX(float angleX) {
        cosAngleX = (float)Math.cos(angleX);
        sinAngleX = (float)Math.sin(angleX);
    }

    public void setAngleY(float angleY) {
        cosAngleY = (float)Math.cos(angleY);
        sinAngleY = (float)Math.sin(angleY);
    }

    public void setAngleZ(float angleZ) {
        cosAngleZ = (float)Math.cos(angleZ);
        sinAngleZ = (float)Math.sin(angleZ);
    }

    public void setAngle(float angleX, float angleY, float angleZ)
    {
        setAngleX(angleX);
        setAngleY(angleY);
        setAngleZ(angleZ);
    }

    public void rotateAngleX(float angle) {
        if (angle != 0) {
            setAngleX(getAngleX() + angle);
        }
    }

    public void rotateAngleY(float angle) {
        if (angle != 0) {
            setAngleY(getAngleY() + angle);
        }
    }

    public void rotateAngleZ(float angle) {
        if (angle != 0) {
            setAngleZ(getAngleZ() + angle);
        }
    }

    public void rotateAngle(float angleX, float angleY,
        float angleZ)
    {
        rotateAngleX(angleX);
        rotateAngleY(angleY);
        rotateAngleZ(angleZ);
    }

}

Limit’s code:

public class Transform {
 
        private Vector location;
       
        private Vector orientation;
 
        public Transform() {
                this(new Vector());
        }
       
        public Transform(Vector location) {
                setLocation(location);
                setOrientation(new Vector());
        }
 
        public Vector getLocation() {
                return location;
        }
 
        public void setLocation(Vector location) {
                this.location = location;
        }
 
        public Vector getOrientation() {
                return orientation;
        }
 
        public void setOrientation(Vector orientation) {
                this.orientation = orientation;
        }
 
        public float getAngleX() {
                return getOrientation().getX();
        }
 
        public void setAngleX(float angleX) {
                getOrientation().setX(angleX);
        }
 
        public float getAngleY() {
                return getOrientation().getY();
        }
 
        public void setAngleY(float angleY) {
                getOrientation().setY(angleY);
        }
 
        public float getAngleZ() {
                return getOrientation().getZ();
        }
 
        public void setAngleZ(float angleZ) {
                getOrientation().setZ(angleZ);
        }
 
        public float getSinAngleX() {
                return MathUtil.sin(getAngleX());
        }
 
        public float getCosAngleX() {
                return MathUtil.cos(getAngleX());
        }
 
        public float getSinAngleY() {
                return MathUtil.sin(getAngleY());
        }
 
        public float getCosAngleY() {
                return MathUtil.cos(getAngleY());
        }
 
        public float getSinAngleZ() {
                return MathUtil.sin(getAngleZ());
        }
 
        public float getCosAngleZ() {
                return MathUtil.cos(getAngleZ());
        }
 
}

Apparently Limits doesn’t rewrite or use other peoples code. /sarcasm

Edit2: Limits erased his main post as soon as he saw the first edit I made to this post. Looks like Sliabsoft & David were right :P.

Read full topic
